itinerary.day1Overview: In the morning, drive to Vijayawada, situated on the banks of the Krishna River in the Krishna district of Andhra Pradesh. Vijayawada, also known as the 'City of Victory', is the starting point for travelers visiting the Buddhist center of Amaravathi. On arrival, transfer to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day2Overview: After breakfast, embark on a city sightseeing tour of Vijayawada. Visit the Kanaka Durga Temple, situated on Indrakeeladri hill overlooking the city and the Krishna River. Explore Akana and Mandana Caves, dedicated to ministers of the 17th-century court of Abdul Hasan Tanashah, and visit the ancient Malleswaraswami Temple on Indrakiladri hill. Later, drive to Amravati to view the ruins of Buddhist Stupas and visit the Ashokan Pillar and Amravati Museum. Return to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day3Overview: After breakfast, depart from Vijayawada for Hyderabad. En-route, visit Kondapalli Village known for its artisans working on Puniki wood and enamel paintings. Continue the drive back to Hyderabad. On arrival in Hyderabad, drop-off at your preferred location.

overView.heading: Ramoji Film City: Movie Magic
overView.text: Immerse yourself in the world of cinema at Ramoji Film City, the world's largest integrated film studio complex. Explore the intricate movie sets, watch live stunt shows, and experience the magic of Bollywood and other regional film industries.

overView.heading: Golconda Fort: Architectural Grandeur
overView.text: Marvel at the architectural grandeur of the Golconda Fort, a magnificent medieval fortification that once served as the capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. Explore the stunning tombs, palaces, and intricate acoustic engineering marvels within the fort.

overView.heading: Charminar: Iconic Monument
overView.text: Visit the iconic Charminar, the famous monument and mosque that has become the symbol of Hyderabad. Explore the bustling markets surrounding the monument, indulge in delectable Hyderabadi cuisine, and soak in the vibrant atmosphere.

overView.heading: Hussain Sagar Lake: Urban Oasis
overView.text: Escape the city's hustle and bustle at Hussain Sagar Lake, a beautiful urban oasis in the heart of Hyderabad. Take a leisurely stroll along the lake's promenade, admire the iconic Buddha statue, and enjoy the serene ambiance.

overView.heading: Salarjung Museum: Rich Heritage
overView.text: Delve into India's rich cultural heritage at the Salarjung Museum, one of the largest museums in the world. Marvel at the vast collection of antiques, artifacts, paintings, and sculptures that span centuries of history and diverse cultures.

overView.heading: Shilparamam: Crafts Village
overView.text: Explore the vibrant Shilparamam, a crafts village that celebrates the rich handicrafts and traditions of India. Experience live demonstrations by skilled artisans, shop for unique souvenirs, and immerse yourself in the colorful cultural tapestry.

overView.heading: Chowmahalla Palace: Royal Grandeur
overView.text: Step into the opulent world of the Nizams at the Chowmahalla Palace, a magnificent palace complex that served as the seat of the Asaf Jahi dynasty. Admire the intricate architectural details, lavish interiors, and gain insights into the royal lifestyle.
